intro: Pycnosphace columbariae, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Plumbaginaceae. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers and spiny, lobed leaves. The plant is native to coastal areas of the Mediterranean and is often found growing in sandy or rocky soils. It thrives in saline environments and is well adapted to coastal conditions. Pycnosphace columbariae is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
